BRING YOUR OWN CAR

EXPERIENCES

LEARN MORE

Drive Pocono Raceway In Your Own Car

and Explore the Limits!

“How do I drive my own car on Pocono Raceway’s track?” If you’re one of the many that has driven our race cars and has pondered this question, our Bring Your Own Car Experience we’ll have you exploring the limits of your own car. With No Speed Limits, Driver Coaching and 2 x 15-Minute Sessions on the 2.5 mile Superspeedway at Pocono Raceway.

To be eligible for our Bring Your Own Car Experience you must complete or have completed one of our Stock Car Driving Experiences within 3 years. If you have not yet participated in one of our Drive Experiences you can combine our 10-Mile or 20-Mile Drive Experience with our Bring Your Own Car Experience on the same date. Save over 10% off when purchasing our 10-Mile or 20-Mile Bring Your Own Car Combo Packages! Limited Availability. For more information and car eligibility select the FAQ dropdown below.

Bring Your Own Car FAQ's

WHO CAN SIGN UP FOR THIS PROGRAM?

You must have completed a 10 Mile or longer Stock Car Drive Experience with Stock Car Racing Experience at Pocono Raceway within 3 years and be at least 25 years old with a valid driver’s license. If you completed a Stock Car Driving Experience with us 3+ years ago, you must re-complete at least a 10-Mile Stock Car Drive Experience(provided at a discounted rate of $289) prior to being eligible for this program. If you would like to do a Stock Car Drive program with us in the morning and drive your own car in the afternoon, as a special incentive we are offering over a 10% discount off the 10-Mile & 20 Mile Drive price when purchased together.

WHAT TYPES OF CARS CAN BE USED?

Any type of gasoline engine sports car or high performance touring car can be used, as long as it has H Speed Rated or higher tires. Electric and Hybrid motor vehicles are not eligible(ie: Tesla).. Only certain SUV’s or Trucks will qualify- GMC Cyclone, Porsche Cayenne or Ford Lightning etc . Convertibles can not be used unless they have an approved type of roll over protection, please call Steve Fox at 877-786-2522 ext.222 to confirm if your convertible is applicable. It will also need to have a current registration, state inspection and insurance. Keep in mind that most of this program will be run at much higher speeds than you see on the highway, so you and the car you choose along with all of its components will need to be up to the task. All cars must pass an in-depth, detailed safety and technical inspection before being allowed on the racetrack. You will be emailed a link to a Tech Sheet with your confirmation along with instructions on how to get it completed. You can also Click Here for the Tech Sheet that is required to be completed and submitted on the day of your event.

HOW FAST WILL I GET TO GO?

While there is no set max speed, how fast you go usually depends on you, your car, and your driving abilities. You should realize that higher speeds will come with knowledge and experience. The first lap of each session will be under a Yellow Flag. We ask that you limit your speed to 70 MPH until the Green Flag is thrown. Under Green Flag conditions we encourage you to safely and smoothly explore the limits of your car and your skills while staying at your comfort level. Remember this is NOT a race and in the interest of safety, we will slow drivers who are demonstrating unsafe and/or irresponsible driving.

HOW MUCH TRACK TIME WILL I GET?

Two 15 minute sessions on track with coaching from your Instructor between.

HOW SAFE IS THIS PROGRAM, I HAVE AN EXPENSIVE CAR?

Very safe, but with any racetrack activity there are inherent risks. Most of the cars used are high dollar, high-end sports and touring cars that have owners who just want a fun, safe place to open them up. Since 2009 we have run this program with zero reportable incidents.

WHAT DO I NEED TO BRING WITH ME?

You will need a high-quality SA rated Auto Racing helmet, preferably full face, SA 2010 designation, or newer. If you do not have your own helmet you may rent one for $25. We also suggest anti-glare sunglasses. You will need to wear a long sleeve shirt and long pants while on-track. Wear narrow lightweight closed shoes with non-slip soles. Food and drinks are available for sale at the track; you may also bring your own.

CAN I BRING FRIENDS AND FAMILY?

Yes! Guests are welcome to share this special experience with you, bring as many as you choose. Your guests can purchase a 3-Lap Ride in one of our 600 HP NASCAR style stock cars while you go thru your Check-In and Drivers Meeting.

CAN I GET MY CAR TECH’D AT THE TRACK?

No. You will need to get your car tech’d in advance. You will be required to hand in your completed tech form at registration on the day of the event. You will be E-mailed a Tech Form along with your confirmation when you purchase your program and choose your date. If you can not run your session due to your car not passing Tech or not having a completed Tech form there will be no refund of any fees paid.

DO YOU OFFER PHOTOGRAPHY OF ME WHILE I AM ON TRACK?

We do. Our Photography Staff will talk with you during your class to confirm if you’d like photographs taken.

WHAT HAPPENS IF I CRASH MY CAR?

You will need to sign a release and waiver of liability, hold harmless agreement at check-in. We are not responsible for any damage to you or your car regardless of whether this damage was caused by yourself in a single-vehicle incident or by another driver in a multi-vehicle incident. We are also not responsible for damage to your car for any reason. Check with your Insurance Company to see the limits of your coverage. Some companies might recognize this as Driver Training; most companies will not cover anything that takes place on a racetrack. Any damage to the Pocono Raceway facility will be the responsibility of the individual causing this damage during the course of this event.

WHAT TIME DO I NEED TO BE THERE?

Car and driver arrival time is 2:00 PM.

WHAT HAPPENS IF IT RAINS?

We will make every effort to run your experience. You must register in person, no matter what the weather looks like at your present location or at Pocono Raceway. We need a dry racetrack; we cannot run in the rain or with a wet race track. If we need to postpone your session because of the weather we will issue you a Rain Check which will allow you to choose another date to return at your convenience and complete your experience.

WHAT IS THE DAY’S ITINERARY?

You will arrive at the track at 2:00 pm where car check-in and preparation begins. Your Driver’s Meeting will begin at 2:30 pm where all the rules of the program are outlined and explained. Your Instructor will pick up the detailed instructions in the classroom where the Stock Car Drive Experience left off. At 3:10 pm everyone will bring their cars up to pit lane and get ready to experience driving your sports car at top speeds through the three different corners and three long straights that make Pocono “The Tricky Triangle”. At approximately 3:30 pm the first group will hit the racetrack for their first of two 15 minute sessions, with on-track activity finished by 5:00 pm.

CAN I TAKE SOMEONE IN THE CAR WITH ME?

No, you cannot. Our Insurance regulations will only allow the driver alone.

CAN I SHARE MY CAR?

Yes, you can. We run a total of four 15 minute sessions so you will each do two 15 minute sessions.

CAN I BUY GAS AT THE TRACK?

Yes! Pocono Raceway sells GT-100 if you would like to purchase fuel at the track please arrive one hour early. Fuel can only be purchased by credit card or you can purchase a Sunoco card from the track.

WHAT ARE THE DATES I CAN SIGN UP FOR?

2024 Season Dates: May 22, June 12, July 22 & Sept. 13

WHAT DOES IT COST?

The cost for this program is $329. With a prerequisite of a 10-Mile or Longer StockCar Driving Experience.
